message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.DS, cs.FL, cs.SC 

This paper deals with the coverability problem for vector addition systems (VAS) that operate on a pushdown stack, which is a problem in the area of formal languages and automata theory. The paper also introduces a new model called grammar-controlled vector addition systems, which falls under the category of formal languages and grammars (cs.FL). The use of pushdown stacks suggests a connection to the area of programming languages and compilers (cs.PL), while the analysis of the model and the decidability result are likely to involve techniques from logic and computability theory (cs.LO). The paper also deals with the intersection of trace languages and context-free languages, which is a topic in the area of formal language theory (cs.FL). Finally, the paper may involve some computational complexity analysis, which falls under the area of theoretical computer science (cs.SC).
